  • Help

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Accuse
Represents the "accuse" command, allowing the player to accuse a suspect to attempt to win the game.
Analyze
Represents the "analyze" command, allowing the player to analyze clues for further insights.
CaseResolution
Represents the case resolution logic for the game.
Clue
Represents a clue in the game, which is a type of item the player can collect in their notebook.
Collect
Represents the "collect" command, allowing the player to collect a clue from the current room and add it to their notebook.
Command
Represents an abstract command that can be executed within the game.
CommandErrorException
Represents an exception thrown when an unrecognized or invalid command is encountered.
CommandType
Represents the various types of commands that can be executed in the game.
Feature
Represents a feature in the game, which is a type of game object that can be part of a room or environment.
Game
The main class for the Mystery Game application.
GameObject
Represents a generic game object that can be part of the game world.
GameState
Represents the current state of the detective game, including the mansion, player, clues, and case resolution.
GameStateFileParser
Utility class for parsing a game state from a file.
Help
Represents the help command, providing the player with instructions or information about various topics related to the game.
Location
Represents a location in the game, which is a type of GameObject.
Look
Represents the "look" command, allowing the player to examine various elements of the game world.
Mansion
Represents the game Mansion, which consists of a collection of locations and the current location the player is in.
Move
Represents the "move" command, allowing the player to navigate to a different room in the game world.
Notebook
Represents a notebook in the game, which is a type of GameObject.
Parser
The Parser class processes a list of tokens and converts them into Command objects that can be executed by the game.
Player
Represents the player in the game, including their name, inventory, and notebook.
Quit
Represents the "quit" command, allowing the player to exit the game.
Status
Represents the "status" command, allowing the player to retrieve information about their inventory, specific items, or their overall status.
Token
Represents a token in the parsing process, consisting of a TokenType and an optional value.
Tokeniser
The Tokeniser class is responsible for converting a string input into a list of tokens that can be parsed into commands by the game.
TokenType
Represents the types of tokens that can be identified and processed by the parser.
